poem.title: Campaign for Real
poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text:
Bellatrix in LCD, a pebble in braille From the island that recurs to me On its own recondite orbit. In my mind The word real that derives from the Latin word for thing, The cortisone that will not let me drift, A missing line that will not let me be.
Go grind some arabica; scorch it on the skillet. Watch the indigo dust on the valley turn like a flock of birds Real rose.
